about_me:
Karl Beer, MD provides comprehensive care for patients with arthritis of the hip or knee including evaluation, x-rays, injections as well as surgical repair. He treats arthritic hips and knees with conservative measures (medication, therapy, injections) until the patient reaches end stage disease causing disabling pain and loss of function of involved joint. 

Dr. Beer participated in advanced training to learn the Anterior Total Hip procedure at age 55 and is certified in the Oxford Partial Knee Advanced instructional course

He states that his spiritual life is very important to him and he tries to incorporate it in his professional life by being aware of his patients’ spiritual needs.

about_me:
I am a board certified general surgeon who specializes in trauma, critical care and emergency general surgery.

As the Director of the Level 1 Trauma program at ProMedica Toledo Hospital, a large amount of my time is spent taking care of some of the sickest patients in the hospital.

While I enjoy the challenge of caring for very sick patients, I also enjoy helping patients with more straight forward surgical problems in my elective general surgery practice.

I have a faculty appointment at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences as a Clinical Assistant Professor of Surgery.

about_me:
I have been a Physician Assistant in the specialty of General Surgery since 1990, and in Bariatric Surgery since 2001.

I treat patients as I would my own family.  If they can go home to their families after our encounter and relay what we discussed and the plan, then I feel I have done my job.

I am interested in improving patient's health and functional status through weight loss surgery, postoperative follow-up and repeated education.

I enjoy providing mentorship to Physician Assistant/Medical students, residents and fellows.

I grew up in Lakewood, Ohio.  I move to Toledo in 1999 for my career.  I have been married more than 25 years to my wonderful wife Vicky, and we are blessed with three boys, Samuel, Christian and John.  I enjoy spending time with my family.

about_me:
Joel Sobecki, FNP is a family nurse practitioner and has worked in family medicine since 2012. He did his last clinical rotation when he was in nurse practitioner school in Fostoria and liked it so much, he stayed there to practice, being hired three months later with Badik and Badik. 

Joel enjoys many aspects and specialties of the medical world, with increased interests in men’s health, infectious diseases, and psychiatric care. He believes preventive medicine is very helpful to try to find something before it becomes a problem later.

Joel tries be as unbiased as he can and solve any problems in an efficient and timely manner. He thinks it is important to have honest discussions with his patients, which is sometimes very hard and delicate but it only benefits everyone involved.

He is married with two little girls and enjoys spending time with them, telling dad jokes, fun trivia or little know trivia facts.

about_me:
Jatin Amin, MD, FACC is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Amin is board-certified in cardiology, interventional cardiology, and internal medicine. 

Care philosophy: He believes in providing the most compassionate care available. Care that is personalized, patient-centered and comprehensive. 

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease (blockages in circulation), cardiomyopathy (heart failure, weak heart), hypertension (high blood pressure), arrhythmia (irregular heartbeat), and valvular heart disease.

Procedures/treatments performed: Stress tests (exercise, nuclear), echocardiogram (ultrasound including TTE, TEE, stress echo), cardiac catheterization (diagnostic and interventional), interventional procedure (PCI, balloon angioplasty, stent implantation), and emergency procedures (STEMI, atherectomy, Intra-aortic balloon pump, temporary pacemaker).

William Colyer, Jr., MD, FACC, FSCAI is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Colyer is board-certified in cardiovascular disease, interventional cardiology, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each individual as an individual. He is committed to practicing evidence-based medicine to help patients live longer, better, and fuller lives.

about_me:
As an orthopaedic trauma surgeon specializing in the treatment of broken bones and their complications, Dr. Jeffery Bair treats injured patients during the difficult and challenging period of time after a traumatic event. This may as mild as trip and fall in the backyard or after a high-energy motor vehicle crash.

Dr. Bair's goal is to help patients by restoring their function after musculoskeletal injuries. Enabling them to maintain a quality of life by getting back to work, keeping active at home, enjoying hobbies and living independently. He collaborates with his trauma colleagues to provide high quality care to thier acutely injured patients.

Dr. Bair has helped to establish the Geriatric Hip Fracture Program – now a JCAHO certified, recognized program at both ProMedia Toledo and Flower Hospitals.

Dr. Bair is involved with resident education both through the University of Toledo, but also at a national level as an AO Faculty member – integral for teaching fracture care to orthopaedic residents across the country.

about_me:
Dr. Donald Crescenzo is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. He is also a board-certified medical examiner. He treats a full range of cardiac issues. 

He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

Dr. Crescenzo is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

Brian Dolsey, MD, FACC, FSCAI is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Care philosophy: His care philosophy is similar to the “Golden Rule” in that he treats patients as he would want to be treated and how he would want his family to be treated.

Clinical interests: Dr. Dolsey’s clinical interests include community health. He is involved in a Barbershop Initiative specifically designed to treat men’s health issues, primarily in the African-American community. He has also been involved in medical mission work in the Dominican Republic.

about_me:
Roger Kruse, MD is board certified in family medicine and sports medicine. He is a member of ProMedica Physicians and brings expertise in regenerative medicine to the Toledo area. He is committed to improving the quality of life for athletes and others who may be living with chronic joint pain, osteoarthritis, tendonitis, torn ligaments or knee, hip, shoulder, back or ankle pain. Dr. Kruse utilizes cutting edge medicine as a non-surgical option to treat patients. Regenerative medicine, which adds an additional element to his current 25-year practice, offers advanced procedures and new techniques. 

Dr. Kruse has been incorporating and practicing regenerative medicine for over 13 years with overwhelming success. He uses advanced procedures like ultrasound and fluoroscopy to guide his PRP and ortho biologic injections. This has drawn international attention and patients have traveled from many countries around the world for treatment.

Nationally and internationally known for his leadership in sports medicine and musculoskeletal medicine, Dr Kruse is committed to utilizing cutting edge regenerative medicine giving patients an alternative to surgery. Dr. Kruse’s extensive resume includes serving as a team physician for three Olympic games (1994 Norway and 1996 Atlanta). He ultimately served as the head physician for the entire United States Olympic Team in Nagano, Japan in 1998. Dr. Kruse is the founder and program director of the University of Toledo Primary Care Sports Medicine Fellowship. Over 29 years the program has successfully graduated over 73 sports medicine physicians that practice throughout the United States. As head physician for the University of Toledo, he oversees all 17 sports and the care of all the athletes.

Dr. Kruse is a Clinical Professor at the University of Toledo College of Medicine and is an Assistant Clinical Professor at the Michigan State University College of Medicine. Nationally, Dr. Kruse has served on the NCAA Committee for Competitive Safeguards and Medical Aspects of Sports from 2014 – 2018. During that time, he was the Chairman of Drug Testing of all NCAA sports. He has also served as a Drug Crew Chief on many international events including the Boston and New York Marathons.

about_me:
Todd Monroe, MD, FACC specializes in cardiology. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions. 

According to Dr. Monroe, cardiology is an everchanging and a strong research-based specialty. Also that evidence based protocols largely dictate treatment and positive patient outcomes.

Dr. Monroe is board certified in internal medicine, cardiology, and interventional cardiology.

Care philosophy: He believes in appropriate aggressiveness and compassionate personalized care. He says his job is to listen to his patients and try to help them achieve optimal health.

Conditions treated: Coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, cardiogenic shock, congestive heart failure, and syncope.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac catheterization, intracoronary stent implantation, intracoronary rotablator and thrombectomy, intra-aortic balloon/ Impella life support, and temporary pacemaker insertion.

More about me: Dr. Monroe is interested in how stress and anxiety play a role in our overall physical health.

His personal interests include family time, scuba diving, golf, travel, trivia, and Kentucky Bourbon.

about_me:
Dr. William Rachwal is board-certified in cardiac and thoracic surgery. His clinical interests include robotic thoracic surgery and he's had advanced training to perfect his robotic surgery skills. In addition to treating a wide variety of heart-related diseases and conditions, Dr. Rachwal also provides ECMO (extracorporeal membrane oxygenation) support to patients experiencing shock and respiratory failure.

Dr. Rachwal's care philosophy is to provide the safest, most effective surgical care for patients with cardiac and thoracic diseases.

He and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

Dr. Rachwal is a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

about_me:
P. Kasi Ramanathan, MD, FACC, is an interventional cardiologist. Interventional cardiology is a subspecialty of cardiology that focuses on treating cardiovascular disease through catheter-based treatments.

Dr. Ramanathan is board-certified in interventional cardiology, cardiovascular medicine, nuclear cardiology, and internal medicine. He also has certifications in peripheral vascular interventions, cardiovascular CT, nuclear cardiology, and echocardiography. And, he is trained and certified in implanting transcatheter aortic valves, transcatheter mitral clips, left atrial appendage occlusion devices, and PFO and ASD closures.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking care of each patient as if they are part of his family.

Procedures/treatments performed: Interventional and structural heart procedures, cardiac catheterization, percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), high risk PCI, STEMI care, and percutaneous valvular intervention.

More about me: Dr. Ramanathan’s interest in cardiology stems from his family members having heart disease. He enjoys cardiology because he is constantly learning new things.

In addition to clinical cardiology, he enjoys working on medical devices to improve patient care. He performs interventional and structural heart procedures in the cath lab.

about_me:
Dr. Chris Riordan is board-certified in thoracic surgery and general surgery. As a cardiothoracic surgeon, he treats a broad spectrum of diseases and conditions involving the heart. Many of the heart issues, tend to be structural or mechanical problems, such as blockages in the coronaries.

Dr. Riordan and his fellow cardiothoracic surgeons strive to make national level care available to patients in the NW Ohio and SE Michigan so that they do not have to travel hours away from their families to receive top-notch treatment. In fact, the quality of care, outcomes and treatment they offer are consistently ranked among the top in the country by credible rating agencies and professional and trade organizations like The Society for Thoracic Surgeons.

Dr. Riordan has been particularly interested in offering the full range of minimally-invasive approaches to patients. He has trained at some of the larger volume heart centers in the country and was also fortunate enough to spend a year in the lab working on projects including development of a newer version of a total artificial heart.

In addition to being a cardiothoracic surgeon, Dr. Riordan also a clinical assistant professor at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

about_me:
Meghan Beck, PA-C is an orthopedic physician assistant that has been working in the acute orthopededic trauma setting since 2010. She manages orthopedic trauma inpatients and outpatients both independently and in collaboration with our orthopedic trauma attendings. Meghan is also first assist in the operating room. She also treats patients for primary and secondary fracture prevention in a bone health program.

Meghan's philosophy of care involves providing evidence based, best practice care while also treating patients as she would want to be treated. 

She obtained her Bachelor’s degree from the University of Dayton while also being a member of their division 1 women’s soccer program. Meghan returned to Toledo to obtain her Master’s degree at the University of Toledo in their physician assistant program. She completed a fracture liaison certificate through the national osteoporosis foundation. In 2018, Meghan was awarded a risk management grant to create a fracture liaison service at ProMedica to improve the quality of fracture prevention care for patients that have sustained a fragility fracture. She also helped create a secondary fracture prevention program to help manage patients who are at increased risk for additional fractures

Meghan grew up in Toledo and returned to raise her family and provide orthopedic care to her community.

about_me:
Tiffanie A. Henderson, CNP has been a nurse for close to 30 years and a nurse practitioner for 10 years. She was one of the last classes to graduate from St. Vincent’s School of Nursing. Tiffanie's first degree was a diploma in nursing. She went on to graduate from Lourdes with her Bachelor of Science in Nursing and her Master of Science in Nursing is from the University of Cincinnati.

Tiffanie's passion for nursing started at a young age and her desire to learn more and to be able to provide more to patients is what led her to becoming a nurse practitioner. She loves the one on one with her patients and the ability to teach them to care for themselves. Tiffanie truly can’t imagine doing anything different.

Tiffanie enjoys her work as a family nurse practitioner as she is able to see multiple family members which helps her better treat the family unit as a whole. She loves the variety of patients that she sees in a day; she might have a newborn well visit in one room and an 80 year old Medicare wellness visit in the next room. Tiffanie believes that patients have a desire to live a healthy life and it is her job to give them the tools to do that.

Lindsey Hickey, RN, MSN, WHNP-BC is a board-certified women's health nurse practitioner in obstetrics/gynecology.

Obstetrics is the medical field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women's health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists help diagnose cervical and ovarian cancers and treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate.

Care philosophy: Lindsey believes that every person should be an active participant in their health. Her job is to help prevent and identify health problems then explain all the possible risks, benefits, and alternatives of treatment options. Then, she and her patients can work together to decide what treatment is best for them.

More about me: Lindsey chose obstetrics and gynecology because of the wide variety within the narrow focus of women’s health. She cares for women throughout their lifetime. She can educate, counsel and help women in the office setting. She becomes part of their family story when caring for them during pregnancy.

about_me:
Kerri Simo, MD is the region’s first fellowship-trained hepatopancreatobiliary (HPB) surgeon. HPB surgery is a surgical specialty dedicated to the diagnosis and surgical treatment of both malignant and benign diseases of the liver, pancreas and gallbladder. She also has additional fellowship training in liver and kidney transplant as well as liver, biliary and pancreas surgery.

Dr. Simo’s clinical interest include minimally invasive liver and pancreas surgery, microwave ablation and irreversible electroporation. She is involved on a national and international level to expand the adaptation of laparoscopic and robotic liver surgery as well as clinical trials to advance the surgical treatment of liver and pancreas cancers. Within her first year of practice here at ProMedica she established and continues to run a support group for post-Whipple patients.

Dr. Simo’s hobbies include reading and running ultramarathons.

about_me:
Chang Xia, MD, PhD, is a board-certified, fellowship-trained hematologist-oncologist. Hematology is the treatment of both cancerous and noncancerous conditions of the blood ranging from anemias, clotting disorders, bleeding disorders, lymphomas, leukemia’s, and other bone marrow conditions. Medical oncology involves systemic treatments including targeted therapy, immunotherapy, and chemotherapy to treat cancer.

Dr. Xia's philosophy of care is to ensure high quality patient care for all her patients. She strives for excellent communication between her patient, the patients’ family, herself, and the other specialist(s) involved in the patient’s care.

Dr. Xia is a long-standing member of both the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) and the American Association for Cancer Research. She was also a recipient of the Scholarship for Outstanding Performance, China Medical University.

about_me:
ProMedica Ear, Nose and Throat, the largest otolaryngology practice in northwest Ohio, provides comprehensive management of disorders involving the ears, nose and throat and other related structures of the head and neck region. Additionally, our physician-led team includes advance practice providers, audiologists and speech therapists. Our priority is to provide patient-centered care that is entirely focused on improving your health and well-being. We provide medical and surgical treatments for a wide range of conditions. Our approach to patient-centered care is what makes the ProMedica ENT patient experience unique.

Dr. Cole is a board certified physician with the American Board of Otolaryngology. She was active duty for the U.S. Navy from 2001 – 2013, and was deployed with 1st Marine Division as Battalion Medical Officer during Operation Iraqi Freedom - Stationed at Naval Hospital, Camp Lejeune, Jacksonville, NC, from 2008-2013. She holds an active membership with the American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery. Additionally, Dr. Cole is a member of the ProMedica Physicians Group Governance Council, a board member of the Toledo Alliance for Performing Arts, and President of the Toledo Ballet Guild.

Special procedures that Dr. Cole performs include Sialoendoscopy, and eustachian tube dilation.

Learn more about ear, nose and throat care at ProMedica

about_me:
Jamie L Dargart, MD is a pediatric hematologist/oncologist.

As Pediatric Hematologists and Oncologists, we specialize in the diagnosis and treatment of blood diseases (hematology) and cancers (oncology) in children.

Care philosophy: I believe that treating children should involve a team - the child, his or her parents or other caregivers, the physician, and other healthcare providers.

More About Dr. Dargart

My special interests include treating children, adolescents and young adults with cancer and participation in clinical trials for children with cancer. I serve as Principal Investigator for the Children’s Oncology Group (COG) at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital. We are the only children’s cancer center in Northwest Ohio to participate in COG, the world’s largest organization devoted exclusively to pediatric cancer research.

I am a native of Toledo.

about_me:
Meghan Keaton, MD specializes in pediatric pulmonary medicine. Pediatric pulmonary medicine is a specialty that helps children who have problems with breathing. The goal of pulmonary medicine is preventing, diagnosing, and treating diseases of the lung.

More about me: Dr. Keaton has been practicing pediatric pulmonary medicine at ProMedica Russell J. Ebeid Children’s Hospital since 2013. She is passionate about caring for pediatric patients with complex and chronic medical conditions.

Care philosophy: Dr. Keaton strives to provide the highest quality and comprehensive health care to her patients and families. She believes in the prevention and early detection of disease. With the most up-to-date medical information and compassion, her goal is to promote healthy, safe, and happy lives. She values her patient's trust and believes in working as a team to deliver the best personalized care for the child and family. For Dr. Keaton, it is important to listen to each family and to recognize, respect, and lean on each family’s strengths to better the lives of the children she cares for.

about_me:
Henry Silverman III, MD is a cardiologist. Cardiology is the study of heart conditions.

Dr. Silverman is board-certified in cardiovascular diseases and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in treating each patient with great respect and intellectual honesty. He also believes in basing his recommendations on evidence/data whenever possible while taking each patient's individual situation, other medical issues, and preferences into account.

Conditions treated: Cardiovascular diseases and rhythm disturbances, congenital heart disease, preventative cardiology, and follow-up care.

Procedures/treatments performed: Non-invasive procedures (echocardiograms, nuclear cardiac imaging studies with exercise testing or chemical/pharmacologic stress testing, plain treadmill stress testing, and stress echo cardiograms either on treadmill or chemical/pharmacologic), Holter and event monitors and resting EKGs, diagnostic cardiac catheterizations, elective cardioversions, 3D echocardiograms and myocardial strain measurements.

More about me: Toledo, Ohio is Dr. Silverman's hometown and where he practiced cardiology from 1981 till 2004. He then joined ProMedica in Adrian, Michigan where he sees patients in the office regularly. He also performs cardiology consults in the hospital exclusively at ProMedica Charles and Virginia Hickman Hospital in Lenawee, Michigan.

Dr. Silverman has served on the Alumni Board of Governors for the Ohio State College of Medicine for the last several years. He is also a die-hard Buckeyes fan. Both he and his father attended Ohio State University Medical School and Dr. Silverman was 6 years old when he attended his father's graduation. Dr. Silverman says his father was an outstanding family practitioner in Toledo and was a great influence on him. He says he is blessed to have had him as his father and mentor.

about_me:
Mandar Joshi, MD is a board certified ophthalmologist with additional subspecialty training in the surgical and medical management of vitreoretinal diseases. He has had the pleasure of providing retinal care to patients in Ohio and Michigan for over the past 15 years. 

Dr. Joshi completed his undergraduate and medical school training at the University of Michigan, subsequently completing his ophthalmology residency at Tufts University and the New England Eye Center in Boston. He then completed a two year surgical retinal fellowship with the Associated Retinal Consultant and Beaumont Hospital in Royal Oak, Michigan.

Dr. Joshi sees patients of all ages with diseases of the vitreous and retinal, both surgical and medical.

Dr. Gupta specializes in sports medicine, shoulder surgery, hip arthroscopy, and cartilage preservation/ligament surgery of the knee. He serves as team physician for the University of Toledo Rockets, Lourdes University, Adrian College and numerous area high schools.

Dr. Gupta completed is medical training at Albany Medical College where he completed an 8-year combined Leadership in Medicine MD-MBA program, graduating with honors. During his orthopaedic residency at Duke University Medical Center, he served as chief resident and associate team physician for Duke University’s football, basketball and soccer teams. He then completed a Sports Medicine and Shoulder surgery fellowship at Rush University Medical Center, where he was as an associate team physician for the Chicago Bulls, Chicago White Sox and DePaul University.

Dr. Gupta is an award winning researcher and has published more than 45 peer-reviewed manuscripts and has delivered numerous lectures at regional, national and international orthopaedic meetings. As an educator he is an Associate Master Instructor for the Arthroscopy Association of North America and regularly participates in educating other orthopaedic surgeons at the Orthopaedic Learning Center in Chicago.

 A former nationally ranked tennis player, in his spare time Dr. Gupta enjoys playing tennis, exercising, and spending time with his family.

about_me:
Dr. Raul Bosio is a board-certified colon and rectal surgeon. He graduated from the University of Cordoba School of Medicine in 1997 as valedictorian. He completed a five-year general surgery residency at the Hospital Aleman of Buenos Aires, Argentina, followed by a 2-year colon and rectal surgery fellowship at the Hospital Italiano of Buenos Aires. He has been involved in minimally invasive laparoscopic colon and rectal surgery since the early 2000s.  

In 2005, he joined the department of surgery at the University of Toledo, and was involved in colon and rectal cancer research, as well as participating in basic science, translational, and clinical research. In 2011, Dr. Bosio completed an ACGME- accredited general surgery residency at The University of Toledo and became board-certified in general surgery. He completed further training by repeating his fellowship in colon and rectal surgery at the University of California, Irvine. During this time, he acquired significant expertise in minimally invasive laparoscopic colon and rectal surgery and robotic colorectal surgery, working under the mentorship of world-renowned experts.

Dr. Bosio’s areas of interest include diagnosis, treatment and long-term follow- up of patients with colon and rectal cancer, inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis), and diverticular disease and associated complications (i.e. colovesical fistula, diverticulitis, stricture, colon perforation or obstruction). Dr. Raul Bosio joined ProMedica Physicians in 2016, after being part of the colon & rectal surgery section at Case Western/University Hospitals in Cleveland.

Dr. Bosio understood long ago that being an excellent physician requires excellent surgical results and the ability to listen to patients and families, while taking the time to explain the disease and the proposed treatment plan. A patient-centered approach ensures treatment options are chosen based on the patient’s individual needs and preferences. As part of the process of striving for excellent outcomes, restoring or improving patient’s quality of life is of paramount importance in Dr. Bosio’s care philosophy. As it is often the case when treating patients with chronic diseases, Dr. Bosio and his health care team focus on working with the patient
and family to make sure they know there is a team of professionals  with them, no matter how hard it may get. Close and frequent communication with multiple health care providers, from PCPs, gastroenterologists, oncologists and others, ensures the primary focus remains on improving the health and well-being of every patient.

Dr. Raul Bosio is part of ProMedica Physicians General Surgery and focuses on colon and rectal surgery. His practice is located in the ProMedica Health and Wellness Center, where he works alongside some of the best general surgery specialists in the area. He has been an integral member of this multi-specialty general surgery practice since 2016. Close collaboration between subspecialties allows for improved patient care across the spectrum of gastrointestinal pathologies and abdominal wall issues (i.e. complex ventral hernias). Multimodal surgical solutions are offered to patients with complex diseases, such as those requiring combined procedures or may benefit from multi-organ resections.

Dr. Bosio has a faculty appointment as a Clinical Assistant Professor of Surgery at The University of Toledo, College of Medicine and Life Sciences.

Dr. Ruddy graduated from Ohio State University College of Medicine and Public Health. She completed pediatric residency at Akron Children’s Hospital in Akron, Ohio and then completed pediatric pulmonary fellowship at Rainbow Babies & Children’s Hospital in Cleveland, Ohio. After fellowship, she practiced pediatric pulmonology at Seattle Children’s Hospital in Seattle, Washington until moving back to Ohio in 2012.
   

Care Philosophy: Dr. Ruddy's care philosophy is to provide the highest quality care for children by working together as a team with the child and their family. Because each child is unique, it is important to get to know each patient well so that treatment can be based on individual needs as much as possible. She strives to provide thorough evaluation and management and provide detailed education and explanation of the condition. She encourages patients and families to ask questions, and believes that all questions are good questions. She feels that routine follow up visits are very important for many pediatric pulmonary conditions. Her goal is that by working as a team with patients and their families to provide the best care possible, they will be able to lead their lives to the fullest.

about_me:
Kara Hertzfeld, MD, is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology.  She puts the interests of her patients first and participates in a multidisciplinary team approach that includes not just radiation treatment, but education and emotional support in a warm, healing environment. Dr. Hertzfeld believes the best patient care is delivered when the patient and physician have a good relationship, and the physician understands the goals and needs of the patient. 

Local to Toledo, Dr. Hertzfeld is a graduate from Perrysburg High School. She enjoys giving back, and being a part of the community she grew up in. 

Dr. Hertzfeld and the ProMedica Physicians Radiation Oncology team provide exceptional cancer care close to home, with facilities located in Sylvania, Maumee, and Fremont, Ohio and Adrian and Monroe, Michigan. Services also include holistic treatment, social work, and dietary.

State-of-the-art diagnostic tests, treatments and supportive therapies: 3-D conformal radiation therapy, High Dose Rate (HDR) brachytherapy, electron radiation therapy, image-guided radiation therapy (IGRT), intensity modulated radiation therapy (IMRT), radiopharmaceuticals, stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT), stereotactic radiosurgery (SRS), *SpaceOAR™, Prostate Brachytherapy.

about_me:
Danine has been a Registered Nurse within the Psychiatric Specialty for over 35+ years of her career. She continued her education to become a Nurse Practitioner for 20+ of those years, to care for people seeking improvement in their own mental health. As our lives change, stressors occur, and things around us evolve, Danine’s philosophy is to treat others the way she would like herself and her family to be treated for mental health issues. We are human beings and the brain is an organ that we cannot live without and requires some special care just as other organs require.

Her clinical interests have varied since each person presents a unique opportunity to meet their needs which involves other conditions, environment, strengths, and willingness to work hard and accept the help of a team of recommended resources. Many people have pain issues, sleep concerns, loneliness to be heard, reassurance of being human and not crazy, and too many more conditions to be named. Danine continues reading the latest research and science publications of new medications, treatments, combined treatments, and discusses with others via networks of associations with other national and international nurse practitioners and psychiatrists.

She enjoys what she does, enjoys meeting the many people she has met throughout her career and looks forward to meeting many new people going forward. Danine recognizes she do not have all the answers, not even close, but she appreciates the hard work each person has done between appointments and has taken on any hurdles or bumps along the way to improving their mental health to enjoy the moment and plan their future. Each person that reaches their individual optimum mental health becomes a success that brings smiles, laughter, and just conversation of hard work that brightens their life and future!

about_me:
Physical medicine is a branch of medicine that aims to enhance and restore functional ability of activities of daily living and quality of life to people with physical impairments or disabilities affecting the spine, nerves, bones, joints, ligaments, muscles and tendons.

Jill Kunisch, CNP attended renowned Dr. Thomas Clark’s cadaver course for hands-on training and ultrasound-guided musculoskeletal injections. She has ongoing collaboration with three well-established, certified physical medicine and rehabilitation physicians and is training with a well-established orthopedic surgeon in diagnosing and treating hip and knee osteoarthritis.

Jill's care philosophy is working cooperatively with her patients in developing a patient centered and evidence based plan of care starting with conservative treatment options and adjusting as appropriate in order to improve her patient’s overall quality of life, function and well-being. There is a strong focus on patient and family education, offering a better understanding of the patient's condition and appropriate treatment options available to them.

Jill states she is a friend of Jesus, mother and wife. She loves animals, the outdoors and being active and leading a healthy lifestyle.

about_me:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that persons individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Kelly appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so we may address your questions and educate you regarding the options of genetic testing. Kelly looks forward to talking with you.
effective_keywords: cancer,conditions and symptoms,genetic counseling,girltalkmay,procedures and treatments

Timothy Phelan, MD is a cardiac electrophysiologist. Cardiac electrophysiology is a field within cardiology that specializes in heart conditions that cause arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation. The specialty also encompasses heart rhythm disorders that requires pacemakers and defibrillators.

Dr. Phelan is board-certified in clinical cardiac electrophysiology, cardiovascular disease, and internal medicine.

Care philosophy: He believes in taking time to know his patients and to understand what is important to them. He also believes that not every treatment is the right choice for every patient.

Conditions treated: Atrial fibrillation, ventricular tachycardia (VT), supraventricular tachycardia (SVT), and cardiomyopathy.

Procedures/treatments performed: Cardiac ablations, pacemaker insertion, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator insertion, and cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT/biventricular devices). 

More about me: His personal career interests include complex ablations of both atrial and ventricular arrhythmias. In addition, he often participates in various multi-center research trials designed to improve future treatments for patients.

about_me:
Michael Tilson, MD specializes in family medicine. Family medicine is a primary care specialty that provides comprehensive care for both children and adults.

Dr. Tilson promotes education and discussion with his patients at each visit in order to ensure that everyone fully understands their chronic medical conditions so that they can be an active, informed participant in their treatment decisions and overall health. He will always promote modern evidence-based medicine and screening guidelines, and stresses the importance of preventive medicine over reactive medicine, since early detection can save lives. Dr. Tilson is motivated daily by the belief that by working to keep his patients at their healthiest, the community around us grows stronger.

During his medical school clinical rotations, Dr. Tilson had the opportunity to live in several large cities from Chicago to Baltimore to Atlanta (and several in between), where he had the opportunity to train at renowned institutions under leaders in their respective fields. He enjoyed every specialty and chose to pursue family medicine so that he could continue to experience all of the different fields of medicine within the office setting on any given day. Dr. Tilson completed his family medicine residency in Youngstown, Ohio, where he served as Chief Resident in his final year of training. Through his journey, he has learned how to practice highly effective medicine with the available resources, while caring for individuals from all different backgrounds and socioeconomic statuses.

Dr. Tilson was born and raised in southeast Michigan and enjoys all of the seasons and natural beauty that the state offers. He enjoys watching and participating in several sports, as well as staying active with outdoor activities such as hiking and boating. Dr. Tilson enjoys traveling and learning about new cultures and languages.

about_me:
More About Me

Sarah Griffith PT, DPT, OCS is an orthopedic and pelvic health physical therapist who has a passion for helping women return to normal function and their favorite physical activities. She is a board certified Orthopedic Clinical Specialist by the ABPTS. As a young mom herself, she especially enjoys and easily relates to patients in the early post-partum period. Sarah is an exercise enthusiast, has trained for triathlons and has a passion for nutrition and all things food. In her spare time, you will find her in the kitchen or spending time with her husband and two active little boys.

Care philosophy

I believe in a holistic approach to treatment; that the mind and body are strongly connected and must be treated concurrently for the best outcomes. I focus heavily on education with patients to help them understand how their bodies work, what their current impairments are and how to take ownership and control back into their own hands. My early career was heavily sports and orthopedic based, so now I combine my passion for an active lifestyle with women's health to help women return to the activities they love. It is important for the patient and provider to have a great teamwork relationship. My goal is to help patients achieve their goals, whether that is returning to daily activities, being active or even running a marathon!

Conditions Treated

Pelvic pain, perinatal and postpartum pain/dysfunction, diastasis recti, adolescent pelvic dysfunction and pain, urinary/fecal incontinence, myofascial pain, low back and hip pain, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, somatic pelvic dysfunction

Procedures Performed

Pelvic floor physical therapy, manual therapy techniques, myofascial release, kinesiotaping, soft tissue mobilization, gait and running analysis. Patient education regarding fluid management, bladder and bowel education.

I enjoy outdoor activities and camping with our family as well as spending time with my network of girlfriends supporting each other as we navigate through motherhood.

Care Philosophy

I believe in a patient centered approach to care, advocating on their behalf for their specific concerns and treatment goals. I strive to focus on patient education for better patient understanding of their condition to empower them to achieve their best outcomes with a treatment plan specifically catered for their needs.

Conditions Treated

Pregnancy and post-partum pain, chronic pelvic pain, diastasis recti, dyspareunia (painful sex), pelvic organ prolapse, stress and urge urinary incontinence, abdominal pain, constipation, fecal incontinence.

Procedures Performed:

  • Pelvic Floor Physical Therapy
  • Manual Therapy
  • Myofascial Release
  • Soft Tissue Mobilization
  • Patient education
  • Bowel/bladder education

about_me:
As an orthopaedic surgeon, the field of adult reconstruction, or hip and knee replacement surgery, allows Tyler Vovos, MD to utilize his engineering and mechanical background to help patients quickly and effectively improve their quality of life.

Dr. Vovos's care philosophy is based on treating patients as if they were a member of his family. Along these lines, he believes every medical decision a patient makes should be a shared one with their physician. Educating patients about all possible non-surgical and surgical options, as well as the risks and benefits of each is important Dr. Vovos. He then engages patients in a meaningful discussion about what the best treatment course for them is. His number one piece of advice for patients is to ask questions. When you are visiting Dr. Vovos, or any other orthopaedic provider, bring these questions with you.

Dr. Vovos has completed extensive training in total knee replacement, partial knee replacement, anterior and posterior total hip replacement, robotic hip and knee replacement, as well as revision (or re-do) hip and knee replacement surgery. He takes pride and passion in helping you and your loved ones in improving quality of life in the most effective and safest way possible.

about_me:
Family Medicine is all about getting patients to the healthiest version of themselves and keeping them there. Family physicians put the emphasis on the preventive therapies. They pride themselves in caring for the whole patient, not a specific organ system or problem.

Muhamid Asif, MD believes in a patient centered and family oriented care. He would like to be the key resource for his patients and empower them by providing appropriate medical information in plain English. Through education and motivational interviewing, he hopes they feel supported to make healthy decisions.

While he enjoys helping patients of all ages and treating all health conditions, Dr. Asif’s special interests include metabolic disorders including diabetes, hyperlipidemia, obesity, and medically supervised weight loss. He enjoys being hands on and offering patients procedural care in the clinic including wound care, skin biopsies, toe nail removal, long term contraception insertion/removal, diabetic foot care and lumps/bumps.

On a personal level, Dr. Asif and his wife enjoy exploring whenever possible with hikes and mountain biking trails. They also love traveling and experiencing new foods and cultures.

about_me:
I grew up in a rural community in eastern Ohio but moved to Toledo for my undergraduate degree in 1996.  I chose to stay in Toledo for graduate school and have worked in brain and spine surgery all but one year of my career.  I love the challenge that Neurosurgery offers and cannot imagine working in a different specialty.  I chose to treat my patients the way that I would like to be treated and believe this helps in making personal connections and fostering trust.  

Navigating the health care system can be intimidating and overwhelming, therefore I try to make the experience more pleasant for my patients. Clinically, I am interested in Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH), Cervical myelopathy, Craniosynostosis, Brain tumors, Lumbar fusion and Revision Lumbar fusion (PLIF/TLIF).  I am trained in pedicle screw placement and fixation as well as Normal Pressure Hydrocephalus (NPH).

about_me:
Hind Moussa MD, MSHI, FACOG specializes in maternal-fetal medicine. Maternal-fetal medicine is a medical specialty that focuses on the care of women with high-risk pregnancies or pregnancy complications. The health of the mother and the fetus are monitored closely during pregnancy. 

Care philosophy: As a maternal-fetal medicine specialist, Dr. Moussa believes that it is her honor and privilege to be there during some of the most exciting yet scariest moments a family may face. From her understanding of the journey those families go through stems her philosophy of the importance of being “present” for her patients during those times. She believes that her ability to be there and to provide support can have a long-lasting impact.

Clinical interests: Dr. Moussa's clinical interests include maternal medical complications during pregnancy, preterm birth and its prevention, as well as quality and safety improvement. On the fetal side, she is interested in fetal diagnosis and fetal neurodevelopment. During her fellowship training she focused her research on the fetal origins of autism etiology in relation to the maternal uterine environment, for which she received the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine excellence in research award. 

More about me: Dr. Moussa is family oriented and enjoys spending time with her daughter, and her niece and nephews. She is multilingual and fluent in Arabic, French and English. She enjoys community outreach both professionally and socially.

about_me:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person's individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. 

As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.  Rachel appreciates many people may be unsure about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you have questions, she encourages you to have an initial consult with a genetic counselor so that we may address your questions and provide education regarding the options of genetic testing. Rachel looks forward to talking with you.
seo_page_title: ProMedica Cancer Institute Cancer Genetics Program
effective_keywords: cancer,conditions and symptoms,genetic counseling,procedures and treatments

Taylor Hahn, SLP is a Toledo native who has been a speech-language pathologist for 5 years. She earned her undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of Toledo. Taylor has extensive experience evaluating and treating with adults in many settings. She has knowledge working collaboratively with individuals diagnosed with head and neck cancers, Parkinson’s Disease, Multiple Sclerosis, stroke, etc. She has helped individuals address difficulties with their speech, language, voice, or swallowing (dysphagia).

Taylor’s focus during evaluation and treatment is to put the patient’s personal goals first. Quality of life is very important to Taylor and she will do her best to incorporate an individual’s desires and wishes into treatment to achieve the best outcome possible. Speaking, being understood, and eating are abilities that are invaluable which is why Taylor will work hard to help her clients regain or manage their difficulties to the best of her ability.

Taylor is certified in the Lee Silverman Voice Treatment (LSVT) – Loud for Parkinson’s disease and Vital Stimulation for dysphagia treatment. She has experience evaluating voice and swallowing via use of fiberoptic endoscopes to determine best course of treatment for her clients. Taylor enjoys learning about best practices in her field of speech-language pathology. She was presented the award for continuing education (ACE) from the American Speech-Language Hearing Association (ACE) in 2020. Taylor will go above and beyond to research information to ensure evidence-based practice is used for everyone’s needs.

Conditions treated: Muscle tension dysphonia (MTD), vocal nodules, unilateral or bilateral vocal fold paralysis/paresis, vocal hoarseness, difficulties with eating/swallowing/choking (dysphagia), chronic cough, tracheostomy care, laryngectomy management, pre- and post-treatment management of disorders caused by head/neck cancer.
effective_keywords: audiology

about_me:
It is estimated 5-10% of all cancers are due to underlying hereditary causes. When we identify a person that has a hereditary predisposition to develop specific cancers, it allows for medical management tailored to that person’s individual risks. It may allow for additional treatment options for one’s cancer. It is also information that can be shared with family members as they may benefit from genetic counseling and possible testing. As a Genetic Counselor, we are uniquely trained to help families understand this information and work closely with their providers to ensure they’re receiving the best possible follow-up and screening.

Many people have questions about the genetic counseling and genetic testing process. If you feel that you would benefit from speaking with a healthcare professional about your personal or family history of cancer, Taylor encourages you to schedule an appointment with a genetic counselor. She looks forward to answering your questions and providing education about genetic testing.
effective_keywords: cancer,conditions and symptoms,genetic counseling,procedures and treatments

about_me:
Vanessa works with children ages 6-18 and young adults who have experienced trauma and are experiencing symptoms of post- traumatic stress, anxiety and depression. She employs various therapeutic approaches while remaining trauma-informed, strength-based and client-centered. Vanessa works to help individuals come to better understand themselves. She also holds a certificate in training in the fetal alcohol spectrum disorder modality to support individuals and families.

Vanessa can also offer family therapy sessions to help families reach therapeutic goals and communicate effectively with one another.

Kristin Campos, PA-C worked in emergency medicine for almost 10 years prior to joining the orthopedics. She believes in the importance of educating patients about their conditions in order for them to be active members of their own care team.

Kristin’s life outside of work focuses on her family and enjoying the outdoors.

about_me:
Alice Bonnell, MD, is a board certified pediatric urologist. Pediatric urology is a surgical specialty that focuses on the evaluation, management, and treatment of urinary and genital issues seen in children. If a child has illness associated with the urinary tract (kidneys, ureters, bladder, and/or urethra) or with the genitalia, pediatric urologists are trained to care for these conditions whether it be through medical management or surgical treatment.

Care philosophy: Dr. Bonnell's goal is to provide quality urologic care to children and their families. She believes that each patient is unique and deserves a care plan designed specifically for their circumstances. She also wants to help educate families so that they better understand the condition for which their child is being treated and can better make the most appropriate choices to direct the care of their child.

Dr. Bonnell completed her training at Cincinnati Children’s Hospital with an emphasis on complex reconstruction. She has experience in caring for patients that require a multidisciplinary team. She values the importance of communication between pediatric providers to deliver the best care for children with multiple or complex medical issues.

More about me: Dr. Bonnell did not always have a career in medicine. She was a fine arts/music high school teacher prior to going to medical school.
effective_keywords: pediatric urology

about_me:
Family medicine provides care to patients all throughout the lifespan in managing chronic conditions as well as treating acute illnesses. 

Allison Glanz, APRN-CNP believes the best part about family medicine is getting to know her patients and establishing a close relationship with them. She enjoys seeing patients at all stages of life and finds it satisfying to see them make progress and build a healthier life for themselves. Allison is interested in promoting a healthier lifestyle by encouraging a healthy diet, exercise, and smoking cessation. 

Allison spent several years in inpatient and emergency nursing.

about_me: Dr. Gandert is a primary care pediatrician. As a mother of two and a person with diabetes, she believes empathy is key in partnering with parents to help every child achieve the best possible health and quality of life. Dr. Gandert is particularly interested in management of childhood chronic illness, medical education, and enhancing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) in healthcare. She received additional training in Rural Community Health during medical school at Michigan State University and completed an additional chief year during residency at Tulane-Ochsner Pediatrics.

about_me:
Mildred (Millie) Silvestri, is a Certified Nurse Midwife and Women’s Health Nurse Practitioner, recently returning to the Toledo area after working as a labor and delivery nurse and training in Chicago, IL. Her love for the birth process began at a young age, hearing her mother who had nine deliveries herself, tell each child their birth story at every birthday.

Her care philosophy is to treat patients the way she would her own family member, and to always listen with purpose. She is passionate about providing obstetrics and gynecologic care to patients of all ages, in all different aspects of life, and she has a strong clinical interest in making the labor process as patient centered as possible. Her doctoral research project was conducted in Chicago, IL regarding educating staff nurses on the benefits of movement and position changes in labor. Millie is excited to have returned to Toledo to serve the community she grew up in.
effective_keywords: midwifery

about_me: Dr. Dunn sees all types of sleep disorder patients, including sleep disordered breathing (sleep apnea), sleep related movement disorders (restless leg syndrome), circadium rhythm sleep disorders, insomnia, and hypersomnia (narcolepsy and idipathic hypersomnia).  She has a special interest in alternatives to CPAP for treatment of obstructive sleep apnea, especially hypoglossal nerve stimulation.
effective_keywords: sleep medicine
colonoscopy,endoscopy,gastroenterology

about_me:
Dr. Gandhi is a fellowship-trained gynecologic oncologist who treats all patients with cancers of the female reproductive tract. Her approach is to manage her whole patient, not just their cancer. She sees cancer care as a journey and wishes to be your guide and partner at every step, from meticulous surgical intervention and targeted chemotherapy or radiation to clinical trials, treatment breaks, survivorship, and/or palliative care. Your goals, support systems, resources, and identities are unique, and navigating each of these is part of a tailoring your comprehensive cancer care plan. Our extensive healthcare team will use all the tools at our disposal to achieve the best outcome for you.

A native of the Chicagoland area, Dr. Gandhi has completed her training in different parts of the country, including Pennsylvania, Ohio, Florida, and Oklahoma. This has allowed her to engage with patients of various backgrounds and belief systems and customize her clinical approach. As a woman of South Asian descent with strong family ties, she understands how ethnicity and culture can influence relationships with the healthcare system. She remains connected to her cultural heritage through Indian performing arts.

Special interests: Diversity, equity, and inclusion in healthcare; fertility-sparing surgery, targeted therapeutics, clinical trial recruitment, palliative care.
effective_keywords: gynecology oncology

about_me: As a Family Nurse Practitioner, I am dedicated to evidence-based practice and providing culturally competent care to diverse populations while buidling long-term therapeutic relationships with patients, family members and staff.  I am impassioned about patient education and promoting sustainable wellness habits to help improve overall physical and mental health.

Victoria M. Kim, MD, is a board-certified surgeon and fellowship-trained surgical oncologist. Her professional interest is in complex abdominal and endocrine diseases, with a special interest in pancreatic cancer. Dr. Kim believes that patients with cancers and complex diseases deserve excellent care from a cohesive team of specialists across disciplines. This led her to pursue specialized fellowship training in surgical oncology at a high-volume center of excellence for cancer care. She is committed to doing her best for each patient she meets.
Dr. Kim's hobbies and personal interests include enjoying large bodies of water, reading, running, hiking, performance arts, dogs and perfecting Korean/Spanish language skills.

about_me:
In addition to earning her Master of Art Degree in Counseling from Spring Arbor University, Heather Frederick, LPC, CAADC, CCS, CCTP, has also worked to obtain several certifications: certified advanced alcohol and drug counselor (CAADC,) certified clinical supervisor (CCS) and certified clinical trauma professional. She is a board member with Recovery Advocacy Warriors (RAW,) suicide prevention coalition of Monroe County, and a state organizer for Michigan Recovery Advocacy Project.

Heather's experience includes providing co-occurring treatment for individual, family and group mental health, and substance abuse counseling for adolescents and adults within various settings such as inpatient, outpatient, primary care, school-based, federally qualified health center and prisons. She has additional training to provide driver’s license assessments, utilization of SASSI to assess level of care and other assessment tools. Heather was involved in a primary care research study for SBIRT which has been shown to be an effective link for individuals treatment of addiction. In therapy, she utilizes ACT approaches, Dialectical Behavioral Therapy (DBT) with a focus on mindfulness, distress tolerance and emotion regulation, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT,) Rational Emotive Behavioral Therapy (REBT,) solution-focused, person-centered therapy, motivational interviewing and additional open-ended concepts. She also provides supervision for professionals in private practice sectors and non-profit agencies that are on a development plan for their CAADC certification and are limited licensed.  Heather supports others in the field and provides consultation as needed.

Heather Lefevre, CNP, is a certified nurse practitioner specializing in pediatrics. Heather believes that patient care should be collaborative, family-focused, and child-centered. She treats her patients and their families with the utmost patience and compassion. She has worked in various positions within the pediatric world for over seven years.

about_me:
Madeleine Craig, MD is an obstetrician/gynecologist. Obstetrics is the field that focuses on caring for women while they are pregnant and during the postpartum period, after the baby is born. Gynecology is a women’s health specialty that screens for and treats diseases and conditions of the female reproductive organs. Gynecologists can also help diagnose cervical, uterine, and ovarian cancer. They treat irregularities or painful conditions in people who menstruate and counsel on contraception.

Care philosophy: Dr. Craig’s care philosophy is centered around listening and collaboration. She believes in listening to her patients’ biggest questions and concerns, reviewing the most up-to-date and pertinent treatment options a patient may have, and deciding upon a plan together.

Conditions treated: Routine and high-risk pregnancies, painful or irregular menstrual periods. Contraception, fibroids, sexual health, menopause, routine screening

Procedures performed: Minimally invasive (robotic) surgery, including hysterectomy, removal of fallopian tubes (salpingectomy) or ovaries (oophorectomy); endometrial ablation, hysteroscopy

More about me: Dr. Craig grew up all over the country, but found her home in Northwest Ohio with her husband and two golden retrievers. In her spare time, you’ll find her enjoying the great food Toledo has to offer, watching a Wolverine or Green Bay football game, or cooking a new recipe.
effective_keywords: gynecology,obstetrics

about_me:
Lauren Blanchard, PA-C, is a certified physician assistant in vascular surgery and medicine.  Vascular medicine involves the study of blood vessels outside of the heart and the lymphatic system.  Vascular medicine specialists study the diseases of the veins, arteries, and connective tissues.  Vascular surgeons provide the surgical treatment of disease in the circulatory system outside of the heart and brain.  Additionally, patients have access to vascular services including vascular testing and rehabilitation, wound care, anticoagulation care, and specialized treatment for varicose and spider veins.

Lauren believes that compassionate care and individualized attention provide the foundation to build a patient-provider relationship that encompasses trust and respect.  Through the aspects of patient education, Lauren's goal is to achieve the highest-level care for the patients of Jobst Vascular Institute, working together to achieve better health and well-being.
effective_keywords: pulmonary embolism,vascular surgery

about_me:
Katilyn Hess, PA-C, brings experience, skill, energy and passion for providing quality patient-oriented care to ProMedica Physicians General Surgery in Adrian, Michigan.  Katilyn's career in healthcare began as a combat medic in the United States Army, Ft. Hood, Texas/Afghanistan, followed by training and experience as a Medical Assistant. Her duties included providing medical care for soldiers in both a clinic setting and in a combat zone.  She continued her education and earned her credentialing as a Physician Assistant. Following her service, Katilyn has worked in various positions and locations, including the Detroit Medical Center, Urgent Care management, and Ascension Health Ministries.

Katilyn is nationally certified by the National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistants.

Christopher Crayne, CNP, is a board-certified nurse practitioner, specializing in vascular neurology.  Vascular neurology is the treatment of stroke and its risk factors.  Christopher has worked in a clinical setting since 2013, gaining extensive skill and experience in a number of medical specialties.

Donielle Whiteland is a Certified Physician Assistant.  Prior to joining ProMedica, she worked in Columbus as a Trauma Surgery and Critical Care Physician Assistant.  She is a former Clinical Athletic Trainer and Certified High School Athletic Trainer.
